newsitem.title: FINLAND: Borealis invests DKK 1.4 bln to up ethylene output.
newsitem.headline: Borealis invests DKK 1.4 bln to up ethylene output.

text.p: Petrochemicals group Borealis A/S said in a statement on Thursday it would invest 1.40 billion Danish crowns to raise ethylene output capacity at the Stenungsund site by 400,000 tonnes per year to 610,000 tonnes.
"Broealis has today announced the approval of a major cracker expansion at its Stenungsund site in Sweden," said Borealis, owned 50/50 by Finnish oil group Neste Oy and Norwegian Statoil.
"The timing of the expansion will be linked to the cracker turnaround in the autumn of 1999 with start-up in the fourth quarter the same year," Borealis said.
The expansion at Stenungsund was in line with a strategy to ensure the long-term competitiveness of major sites.

"In addition to improving the competitive position of the cracker, the expansion will improve the site's ethylene balance and enlarge the internal supply of ethylene to support the planned polyethylene developments," it said.

Borealis also said it had entered long-term feedstock agreements for the supply of ethane involving some 600,000 tonnes per year. Some 300,000 tonnes of this would go to Stenungsund and the remainder to the Noretyl cracker which is jointly owned by Borealis and Norsk Hydro.
